Syndicalism.definition: a doctrine or practice promoting the revolutionary seizure of government and industry see also criminal syndicalism
Syndicalism.origin: [French syndicalisme , from ( chambre ) syndicale trade union, from chambre chamber + syndicale , feminine of syndical of or relating to a syndic or to a committee that assumes the powers of a syndic, from syndic government office]

1.1: a doctrine or practice promoting the revolutionary seizure of government and industry see also
